Reviews.Title: “Don't pay more than $29.99”
Reviews.Author: BPWFJW
Reviews.Content: If you pay what their sign out front advertises, then you're close to getting your money's worth. Anything over $29.99 is WAY too much for this dirty, smelly, and falsely advertised motel. It's only redeeming quality is that it's across the street from Circus Circus and costs slightly less. Our family felt dirty just standing in the lobby, the parking lot, and the room. The advertised free breakfast is basically nonexistent (small packaged muffins only), the internet service is weak at best, and the rooms were disgusting. On a brighter note, at least there was a locked cage on the window to keep the riff-raff out. It's not very comforting looking through your barred up window at an abandoned parking lot (on the strip no-less). We overpaid because we passed through town on a Saturday night during the NCAA tournament, but if you're asked to pay anything over $29.99 find somewhere else. Oh yeah, one more thing - we heard every noise that was made in the rooms on each side of us and above us. Lovely...

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for the poor quality”
Reviews.Author: Angele C
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatley I had to make a reservation quickly on Friday night. I had to pay 110.$ for a pretty bad room. Did not want to know who was in this room before me. Pretty shabby. Also scary because I was on the ground floor and I was a woman alone We are in the shadow of Circus Circus. Took a sleeping pill to be able to sleep and forget where I was. A few channels on TV, the sheets were stained the breakfast was terrible a few wrinkle muffins and yogourt or was it juice? Did not touch it, went to Denny's instead. I wonder what year this hotel was built, did not see any pool but a vaccant lot at the back... Old windows looked like old windows on a old mobile home... Could not wait to get out of there. The lady at the front desk was nice. I could hear somebody walking and moving things around on the second floor just over my head and people walking right by my windows with curtains that did not close properly. No sound proof there. Note I am not a gambler and doesn't like Vegas I was just there to take a plane the next day. I was coming from another Travelodge and was satisfied there but a warning the Travelodges are not all created egal.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better for less”
Reviews.Author: tinachism
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Travelodge we've ever seen. The carpets were absolutely horrible, and no amenities other than a coffee pot. As for a great location, there is little but construction nearby so its quite a walk down the strip. Yes, its pet friendly, but your dog had better be used to using the concrete, as grass is in short supply. We found a better rate and cleaner quarters on the west side- still quick to get to the strip where free parking is abundant anyway. I would not advise anyone to stay here. Oh, and the breakfast- well, you have from 6 a.m. to 8 a.m. to pick up your apple and packaged muffin!

Reviews.Title: “First hotel room without a dresser!”
Reviews.Author: ladarlene
Reviews.Content: You expect certain necessities in a hotel room, and a dresser in which to store clothes is one of them, IMHO. While the location was good for us, and the price (avg $36 night), we'll be living out of our suitcases for 5 days. I guess when you get the handicap accessible room, with a wall mounted TV, you give up the combo TV/dresser other rooms have. The only suggestion from the pleasant front desk clerk, "You can use the nightstands..." Don't think so!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: mr_caroline
Reviews.Content: We booked into Travelodge as we have been to Vegas many times and didn't really want to pay last minute weekend prices for a strip hotel. Travelodge was brilliant. Really great value for money. Its close to the strip, much closer than the motor manor lodges at Circus Circus which are about the same price. The rooms aren't big, especially by Vegas standards, but the bed was comfortable and bathroom amenities provided. We booked a smoking room, and it did have quite a strong smell to it, but this was our mistake when booking and really I shouldn't complain. Our room had coffee making facilities - the first time I have seen this in any hotel in Vegas, so was quite happy about that. There was a pool! Really wasn't expecting that. It got sunlight quite late into the day and there was no one else in it. A private pool in Vegas, you don't mind that often! The rooms had complimentary wifi which was another unexpected bonus. In fact everything about this Travelodge surpassed my expectations. I booked it a little disappointed that I hadn't got my act together and booked a hotel, but the Travelodge proved a great success and when I was sulking about my room in the Flamingo a few days later, I wish I had gone straight back. The staff at the Travelodge were lovely!! Don't rule Travelodge out for your stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Good news, bad news”
Reviews.Author: TLMitchell
Reviews.Content: In a town with thousands and thousands of rooms at every price point why would anyone stay in a motel that's seen better days? Personally, I prefer a direct-exit where you can park in front of your door for easy access to your vehicle. Few and far between amidst the plethora of high-rise hotels & casinos. Good news, Michelle and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The accomodations, while a bit dated and rough around the edges, were comfortable and adequate. My smoking room actually had a clean, fresh smell with just a mild odor of disinfectant spray. Not so good.... unlike almost every other place you check in these days there was no microwave or refrigerator in the room. A portable refrigerator is available for a reasonable additional charge. Try finding a place to plug it in! All of the wall plugs were two-prong only, the fridge requires the 3rd ground hole. The maintenance gentleman finally resorted to plugging it in around the corner in the bathroom. Speaking of outlets.... a nice work desk for working on the computer... with no outlet anywhere within reach! The WiFi range was extremely limited, although I wasn't far from the office I was able to connect sporadically and experienced frequent disconnects. A friend staying at Circus Circus across the street gave me their password and I used their WiFi. The worst... the floor of the shower was absolutely disgustingly cruddy! As is seen frequently in many mid-priced motels, housekeeping staff spritzes some cleaner or disinfectant in tubs and showers and gives them a wipe making them *appear* somewhat clean. The floors rarely get the good scrub required to keep the crud from being embedded. The first morning upon discovering this I showered in my socks because I forgot my flip-flops and I didn't want any part of my body touching anything in that shower stall. I picked up some shower togs locally as well as some Soft Scrub and an abrasive cleaning pad and my efforts didn't put a dent in the crud on the shower floor! One other not-so-hot feature, there are several enclosed stairwells leading to the 2nd floor. If you get a room located behind one of these enclosures you won't have a clue whether it's night or day when you open your door. They totally block the outside world. Would I stay here again? Possibly, if it was important to have easy access to my vehicle. I'd take a closer look at the room before unpacking though. I'm not one to complain too much although I'm sure the staff would have changed my room if I had asked. As I said, the employees were a high point!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisified”
Reviews.Author: LHO39
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the ground floor rooms (very convenient parking at the door) in November of 2009. The room was satisfactory, functional, clean. The workers were terrific. As to location ... RIGHT ON THE STRIP. Handy but it requires some walking as the strip is a street, not a spot. Recommend this hotel when the price is low. Too bad the cost bounces sometimes. Like in two Saturdays when we will be staying somewhere else with uniform pricing. Overall rating VERY GOOD due to location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: Goldvsmith
Reviews.Content: Booked this lodging several months in advance because I knew we would arrive llate. Why pay over $100 for the night just for 10 or so hours. The room served the purpous perfectly. An old facility a little rough around edges, but clean and quite. Circus Circus is next door and Rivera is across the street. Both a short safe walk. $47

Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: John n
Reviews.Content: II had a very nice time in Las Vegas I wiii be back nexet year. The rooms where very clean. this is all for now and food was very good.. from John nelson

Reviews.Title: “Decent motel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: rtw_rachel
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet enough, great price, nice staff. We chose this Travelodge because of price, and location on The Strip, and there being no reports of bedbugs. There's no wifi in the rooms, but we knew that going in. I hadn't been to LV since I was a kid and didn't have a very good sense of the Strip. Now that the Sahara is closed and other places have been torn down, Circus Circus is in a rather isolated part of the Strip. We ended up using the Monorail, but because the Sahara is closed, it's a LONG walk to the station from this motel because the Monorail veers off the Strip at the north end--the walk in the summer is quiet oppressive! If I go back, I'll look for a motel that's just off the Strip, but closer to the action (or get a hotel package).

Reviews.Title: “Yikes!! Horrible...”
Reviews.Author: nomey
Reviews.Content: Our room was disgusting. Our room smelled dirty and like mildew. There was a hole in the wall about the size of your fist. The carpet was filthy. I didn't even want to lay on the bed. It was only 1 night...and who sleeps in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: merchus
Reviews.Content: Good location for a trip with friends. Right next to Circus Circus... a little bit north from the biggest attractions on The Strip, but still "in the zone". Really nice staff, friendly and helpful! Perfect english / spanish speakers. Rooms are a little small but ok for the money. Remember you won't get the real Vegas experience in this kind of hotel, but this is a great choice for a several night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent service all around!”
Reviews.Author: Pinguina_78
Reviews.Content: From a far this hotel looked like it was not going to impress me, but let me tell you they sure proved me wrong. The service I received was excellent from the moment I walked in to the office to check-in. I was greeted by friendly staff, I even met the general manager, very nice gal. The room was clean, and very cozy. We had a nice view of the strip, and a short distance from the Treasure Island & I enjoy the fact that it is right across the Circus-Circus, and with having kids its a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Simon11234
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas a few times so I didn't feel the need to stay at a luxury hotel again. A friend of mine stayed at the Travel Lodge before and recommended that I stay there because they were located on the strip, newly renovated and had a large pool. I was not disappointed! Great staff, Ample Parking, and your right on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Spicki
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Travelodge for only one night to catch my early flight next day. Upon arrival check-in was exemplary. Even though I requested a room on the 2nd floor I was offered a room on the 1st floor because they have been remodelled recently. I'm glad I followed the advice because the remodelled room was very cozy and nicely designed. The room was clean and the only thing worth mentioning was a water damage at the ceiling above the tub. The front-desk staff would even call and make sure if I actually liked the room - I was impressed again! Next morning - I checked out around 6am - the breakfast area was not prepared yet. I was pleasently surprised by the fact that the front-desk staff realized this and handed me a breakfast to go without me even asking for it. Based on my previous experience this is the best service I ever received in any of the many Wyndham Hotel Group places I stayed at in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Marlonasinbrando
Reviews.Content: I really like it. This is my second time staying at this hotel and every time that I'm here the staff has been very helpful. It is really close to the strip which makes it a great place to stay when you want to enjoy the night life of Las Vegas. After you've had a long night of partying, just come back to sleep at a cozy place without having to go through a huge casino and 30 floors to get to your room. I slept like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: thatblondeone
Reviews.Content: So we get there and then we fidn that we need the credit card to check in so we had to fax it in. The front desk chick was so rude and cranky. There is only one ice machine and it is next to the lobby. The center stairwell is badly lit and is confined so its exceedingly creepy. The rooms were gross. They are tiny. Terrible lighting. No tub jsut a stand in shower. The TV had like 15 channels and they flicker in and out. No good interesting channels. TV remote was broken, like it was literally broken you could shake the remote and the batteries slide and htere are broken pieces in it. Oh did I mention there was only two outlets. The closet was a hole in the corner of the room. Literally a hole. I swear I opened the door once and saw somehting run across the floor. Needless to say I did not sleep in the bed...on top. Oh and the wierdest people stay there. You walk by some of the rooms and there are people standing at their windows and they jsut stare at you as you walk by. It was cheap and there is a good reason why. NEVER AGAIN!

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge Las Vegas
HotelInfo.Address: 2830 Las Vegas Blvd S, Next to Circus Circus, Las Vegas, NV 89109
